H0.text: What was the occupation of St Peter, the leader of the Apostles. Merchant

H1.text: What was the occupation of St Peter, the leader of the Apostles. Carpenter

H2.text: What was the occupation of St Peter, the leader of the Apostles. Shepherd

H3.text: What was the occupation of St Peter, the leader of the Apostles. Fisherman

A4.text: Andrew, who was the disciple of John the Baptist, and another unnamed disciple of John the Baptist, traditionally believed to be John, upon hearing the Baptist point out Jesus as the 'Lamb of God', followed Jesus and spent the day with him, thus becoming the first two disciples called by Jesus. For this reason the Eastern Orthodox Church honours Andrew with the name Protokletos, which means 'the first called'. Despite Jesus only briefly requesting that they join him, they are all described as immediately consenting and abandoning their nets to do so.
